name: Hidden Mini Zoo Bali
address: Banjar Sakih, Jl. Pandu, Guwang, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1:
One of the most charming and intimate zoos I've ever had the pleasure of visiting, this zoo offers a unique and heartwarming story. It all began with the owner‚Äôs passion for animals, starting as a backyard sanctuary and blossoming into a conservation effort funded through selling photographs of the well-cared-for animals. This new site caters to a growing interest from tourists while allowing the collection to expand, showcasing how a zoo can be ethically managed.

True to its name, the zoo is small and perfect for families like mine, with in-laws and two primary-aged girls. While it may not yet be widely famous, it offers an incredible, interactive experience that captivates visitors of all ages.

Though I‚Äôm no animal expert, the gentleness and calmness of the animals reflect the tender care they receive from the dedicated zookeepers. Walking through the enclosures, we encountered rare birds, free-roaming lizards, and a variety of fascinating creatures including bats, owls, hedgehogs, parrots, snakes, spiders, and scorpions. The friendly staff guide both animals and guests to create remarkable photo opportunities, all complimentary, without any hidden charges or tips expected.

If you've read this far, you're likely the kind of thoughtful tourist who would appreciate this place. Running a zoo is no easy feat, balancing ethical considerations with financial viability. I hope the owner shares more of their inspiring story in the future. This experience not only fosters a love for animals and the earth but also makes conservation a tangible and educational endeavor from the grassroots level.
review 2: Our 4 and 2 year old girls enjoyed this much more than the Bali zoo..very different kinda animals of course so don't expect to see elephants, lions etc. Instead they have birds, monkeys and a whole bunch of cool reptiles, lizards, snakes etc which you can hold and interact with. Very friendly staff and knowledgeable too. Ticket includes a free drink and souvenir (a cute bottle opener keychain). Takes about 2 hours max but worth it. Highly recommend ‚ù§Ô∏èü¶éüêçü™≤üï∑Ô∏è
review 3: We had such a wonderful time at the Hidden Zoo. When we pulled up to it I wasn't sure we were in the right place as we had to follow a path past rice feilds and then we eventually ened up at the zoo. I highly recommend this place and its amazing kids and adults if you love animals. It is a small place but wow did it leave an impression. We got to hold Spiders, Snakes, Lizards, Scorpios, Birds, Bats, Hedgehogs and even a beautiful Luwak. You could hold them.as long as you like. The animals a well looked after and if they don't want to be on you then they are not forced too. There was also a beautiful Cafe at the back of the zoo over looking some rice fields. Also when the clouds cleared we could see Mt Agung
review 4: A great little fun half day excursion. Lots of cool animals and up close encounters. Lovely restaurant at the end with nice views over local rice patties.Not sure how busy it gets - we arrived at opening time, walked right in and then had breakfast after walk through.
review 5:
Not much street parking available, our driver was skilled to park where he did with assistance from their security. A short walk down towards the zoo which was nice. 200k per adult entry and a voucher for Cafe was given along with a free Souvenir (bottle opener).

Upon entering I did panic as a large monitor walked towards us at pace, I was wondering if it had escaped but it only wanted to lay in the middle of the footpath üòÖ

The exhibits could benefit from being larger and having larger pools available for the animals to bathe/drink from. I do wonder if the animals are offered any forms of enrichment. We were given what appeared to be cat food to feed both the peacocks and monkeys üò≥ not sure how biologically appropriate that is.

Staff were very friendly and made sure to offer interactions with all the animals available however they would often give you an animal and walk off to assist others üòÖ so you'd have to find them to return the animal or put it back into the enclosures/containers they had. It was a relatively short experience, perhaps about an hour? But that was perfect for us as we had lots of interactions and then left to continue our day trip. At the end there is a Cafe which we didn't go to but staff reminded us of the vouchers we were given at the start and gave us two soft drinks in exchange for the vouchers. They also had the cutest toilet I've ever seen, pebbles and planted with Anthurium üòÇ

It was nice to know our driver had an area to sit and have a coffee/smoke while we did our thing.

name: Warung Mek Resi
address: Jl. Bema No.14, Guwang, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Hidden gem in local neighborhood. Very tasty and delicious. If you like local food, you should try. Highly recommended after you finished trekking at Hidden Canyon Beji Guwang.
review 2: After eating Rujak Kuah Pindang and Tipat here, I got hooked with local Balinese food! It can be long wait because the lady makes the Rujak/Tipat fresh by order. The location is bit hard to find, but it‚Äôs worth it & the price is very reasonable.
review 3:
I was offered $5,000 to sell my account to an advertisement firm

It was a tempting offer, but in the end I had to decline. My morals are strong and intentions are good, just like the wonderful people at Nestle.
review 5: hidden gem, but maybe need for better system food preparation take quite long

name: Warung Pondok Rare
address: Bila Sari, Jl. Nakula No.01, Guwang, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Nice place, feels homey. Food is great, kinda spicy but thats how its supposed to be haha. Price is okay, service is okay.
review 2: Delicious food, but need to improve their service of hospitality. Recommended to use motorbike to reach this restaurant
review 3:
For True Adventurous Foodies Only...
Mince Raw Pork with Bali Authentic Herbs and Spices... Akin to French's Beef Tartar... Trully Great experience, amazing taste. A true Bali hidden gem. Cant miss this!

name: Warung Nagi I Wayan Merta
address: Gg. Sandat 4, Guwang, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: The skin, the pork, the lawar with pork is not smelly at alllll, its like eating tar tar :))
review 2:
I went to eat there together wir my bff we ordered lawar campur with rice without any drink , we should have pay 50k and the owner said we have to pay 90k ü§Ø it‚Äôs a scammer he saw that we are tourist and he gave us higher price.
Definitely I don‚Äôt recommend this place !
For 90k u can eat in a nice restaurant not this kind of place ‚Äúon the street‚Äù
I would recommend to ask about the price b4 u order
review 3: Amazing balinese cuisine experience. We tried Nasi Lawar Plek Samsam Guling (red) and we're hooked. One of the highlight is fresh black pepper. It really explode in your mouth. Plus the house is beautiful with a Koi pond and a (tiny) pig pen, so we're certain that the ingredients are fresh. Two thumbs up. üëçüëç
review 4: Very nice local Warung. The family is very kind and the food (of course local) is delicious. If you want to experience a local restaurant you should go to this place. But you must be open minded, as they speak no english, you will get a dish without maybe knowing every ingredient. It is no place for vegetarians. We loved it here and it was one of our must exciting diners in bali and we will remember it forever!

name: Babi Guling Mesari Pak Nono
address: 97PM+7FR, Jl. Raya Guwang, Guwang, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Very local babi guling place. Their nasi babi guling is good, with 2 options of small or regular. Taste wise is delicious with crunchy moist skin and crispy chicaron, spicy lawar and sambal with good portion of rice. Definitely recommended place if you passed by the area.

name: ACK Fried Chicken Guwang
address: 97PM+R93, Jl. Raya Guwang, Ketewel, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1: Just a typical local fried chicken restaurant, decent fried chicken, super reasonable priced, and that's all. Just lacking parking for cars so you need to park on the street and be sorry for causing a little traffic, lol.
review 2: Good cheap food. Clean. Loud roadside
review 3: The staff very welcome and funny, ordinary place
review 5: The place is easy to search

name: Br Sakih Desa Guwang

name: Lilac Restaurant
address: Jl. Pandu, Br. Sakih, Guwang, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1:
Very peaceful atmosphere. The girl who served us food has a good English knowledge. Food is very tasty! We wanted to eat salad but without meat, and they made delicious vegetarian variant of Caesar salad. It was so tasty that we ordered it twice!
I do recommend to try Hazelnut Latte here. It is not very sweet, exactly how it should be.
It is so peaceful here, that it was hard to go away.
Thank you very much for a good rest and interesting conversation üôè‚ô•Ô∏è
review 2:
Nice view , rice field, mountain & sea.
Wait here when my kid enjoy the Hidden Bali Zoo.
review 3: Perfect spot to go for lunch before or after visiting the hidden mini zoo. Super yummy juices and delicious menu. Amazing view over the rice paddies. It's at the end of the zoo but if you are too hungry before seeing the animals you can go there first before buying the ticket. The manager was around and giving excellent training to the employees to ensure quality and consistency. We'll be back.

name: Nick's Guest House-Sukawati
address: Gang Seruni No.10, Guwang, Kec. Sukawati, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80582, Indonesia
review 1:
nice bathroom for the price, the room is okay, air conditioning is available.
The owner is very very nice, very accomodating and friendly: he gave us 2 bikes for free to roam around the villages.
The hotel has a cheap snacks&beers available, a taxi service...
Bonus point for the 4 cute doggos here.
We had a delightful stay at Nick's guest house.
review 2:
STAY HERE. This place is Nirvana. Nick and his family are some of the kindest and most genuine people you might ever meet. He and his daughter are so helpful and in such a non-judgmental way. They will tell you as much or as little as you want to know about their way of life, their families, traditions, and culture. These are the kind of people that if they only had one shirt, they would give it to you off their back if you were in need.

Also, Sukawati is a really remarkable and local-feeling town. There are little to no tourists here and it's a very genuine experience.
review 3: Clean place. Lovely surrounding and great host. Nick is the best host we had in bali ‚ô°
review 4: Nick and his family are adorable, will do anything to help and guide you, and make you feel comfortable. Recommend 10000% !!
review 5: Great place, peaceful almosphere, friendly people! Thank you Nick!
